pullRequest.body:
This proof is a horrible case bash. I have already spent a significant amount of time optimising it.

From LeanCamCombi

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [113a774cb9](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13827/commits/113a774cb94da9b6dfa2b7e9b47f36703ebddfaf)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ cons_le_cons`
`+ cons_lt_cons`
`+ erase_le_erase`
`+ erase_le_erase_min'`
`+ erase_lt_erase`
`+ filter_inj`
`+ insert_le_insert`
`+ insert_lt_insert`
`+ instBoundedOrder`
`+ lt_iff_exists_filter_lt`
`+ ofColex_top`
`+ toColex_univ`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

I should mention that @b-mehta claims to have a shorter proof of the titular result, but I haven't seen it yet. If you want my opinion, I think we shouldn't block on that since:
1. It's easy to golf a posteriori
2. This PR is a part of a long sequence towards the Kruskal-Katona theorem, and progress is slow enough already like that
bors d+

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Let's go! Kruskal-Katona is getting very near.

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9978903548/job/27576811692)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9978903548/job/27576811494)

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma cons_le_cons (ha hb) : toColex (s.cons a ha) ≤ toColex (s.cons b hb) ↔ a ≤ b := by
```

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma cons_lt_cons (ha hb) : toColex (s.cons a ha) < toColex (s.cons b hb) ↔ a < b :=
```

```suggestion
  le_top _x := toColex_le_toColex_of_subset <| subset_univ _
```
Some more dollars
I think this could do with a docstring

Do you think the `∀ ⦃a⦄, w < a → (a ∈ s ↔ a ∈ t)` here would be better as `s.filter (w < .) = t.filter (w < .)`? Or even using
```suggestion
    toColex s < toColex t ↔ ∃ w ∈ t \ s, s.filter (w < .) = t.filter (w < .) := by
```

I've tried your suggestion in https://github.com/YaelDillies/LeanCamCombi/blob/master/LeanCamCombi/Mathlib/Combinatorics/Colex.lean but somehow it makes everything more painful. It seems reasoning about colex really is done element-wise.
Did you mean to link to a different branch that contained this suggestion?

No sorry, I only changed things in local because it was pretty clear pretty quickly that your approach wouldn't work

I could try redoing it if you think it's valuable
Would a `s.filter P = t.filter P ↔ ∀ ⦃a⦄, P a → (a ∈ s ↔ a ∈ t)` lemma make my suggestion more pleasant? I just think it's easier to read, even if it doesn't help much with proofs.
Sure, I guess I can do that
What's the status of this conversation?
Sorry, forgot to resolve

Did you mean
```suggestion
/-- If `s ≤ t` in colex and `s.card ≤ t.card`, then `s \ {a} ≤ t \ {min t}` for any `a ∈ s`. -/
```
This needs to be moved.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: If `s ≤ t` in colex, then `s \ {a} ≤ t \ {min t}` in colex
